pageContext.claim: “And I hate to tell you, we should have won New Hampshire. That was taken away. New Hampshire was taken away. It was taken away from us, but we should have. We did great in New Hampshire. We should have won New Hampshire, but that's OK. I'm not holding it against you because it was not your fault.”
pageContext.analysis: There's no evidence of voter fraud in New Hampshire in the 2016 election. Trump routinely offers conspiracy theories to suggest he did not really lose the popular vote to Hillary Clinton.
